subject: Medicine
title: Patient Zero
description: Learn Patient Zero in one minute.

hook.text: Every pandemic starts with one person. Finding that person can reveal where the virus came from.

buildup.text: Patient zero is the first identified case in an outbreakâ€”the index case that starts the chain.

discovery.text: Tracing patient zero reveals the source: a market, a farm, a hospital, or an animal reservoir.

twist.text: The real patient zero is often never found. The person identified is usually just the first one noticed.

climax.text: Finding the origin matters because stopping the source prevents the next outbreak from the same place.

punchline.text: Pandemics start with one. Prevention does too.

quiz.question: Why is finding patient zero important?
options: It reveals the source and helps prevent future outbreaks
It determines who should be blamed for the pandemic
It always identifies the exact animal that carried the virus
